src.groovy.org.grails.jaxrs.support
Class DomainObjectWriterSupport

java.lang.Object
  src.groovy.org.grails.jaxrs.support.DomainObjectWriterSupport

class DomainObjectWriterSupport

A message body writer that converts Grails domain objects to XML or JSON entity streams. The expected response content type is specified by the Accept request header. Supported content types by this provider are text/xml, application/xml, text/x-json or application/json. Assuming Note is a Grails domain class. This provider supports usage of resource methods such as: 

 @Path('/notes')
 class NotesResource {
 
      @GET
      @Produces(['application/xml','application/json'])
      Note getNote(...) {
          Note note = ... // e.g. load a note object from database.
          return note
      }
      
      @GET
      @Produces(['application/xml','application/json'])
      Collection<Note> getNotes(...) {
          def notes = ... // e.g. load list of note objects from database.
          return notes
      }
      
      @GET
      @Produces(['application/xml','application/json'])
      def getNotes(...) {
          def notes = ... // e.g. load list of note objects from database.
          return notes
      }
      
 }
author:
Martin Krasser

isDomainObjectCollectionType

private boolean isDomainObjectCollectionType(ParameterizedType genericType)

isEnabled

protected boolean isEnabled()
If false this writer will be skipped. Returns true by default.

isRequireGenericCollection

protected boolean isRequireGenericCollection()
If true resource methods must declare a generic collection type as return type if this provider should handle the return value. The collection type argument must be a domain class. If false this provider handles any returned collection, assuming that the collection elements are domain objects. Default value is false i.e. any collection is handled.

isWriteable

boolean isWriteable(java.lang.Class type, Type genericType, Annotation[] annotations, MediaType mediaType)
Returns true if type is a Grails domain class or domain class collection and the mediaType is one of text/xml, application/xml, text/x-json or application/json.
